channel.title: JTextArea
channel.description:
is there any way to get a single line of text out of a JTextArea example:
the JTextArea says : [code] test1 test2 test3 test4 [/code]
and i want to get lets say the text in line 3 wich would be "test3" so how would i be able to do this??

Read full topic

item.title: JTextArea
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

What I mean is:

[code]int lineNo=0;
StringBuilder out = new StringBuilder();
char prev;
for(char c : textArea.getText().toCharArray()) {
// Capture characters on our line.
if(lineNo == requestedLine) {
out.append©;
} else
// If we’ve already got the data from our line, exit the loop.
if(out.length() > 0) {
break;
}

if(prev == '\r' && c == '\n' && os = windows) {
	lineNo++;
} else if(c == '\n' && os = linux) {
	lineNo++;
} else if(c == '\r' && os = Mac) {
	lineNo++;
}
prev=c;

}[/code]
Half pseudo-code Not sure if that would work.

On second thoughts, Scanner probably makes more sense. Use a delimiter [\r\n]{1,2} (I think)

Read full topic

item.title: JTextArea
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

Iterate through the charss, when you reach an end of line (CR, LF) then increment the lineNumber variable. When lineNumber = 3, add all the characters to a StringBuilder. When lineNumber increments again, return the String.
My explanation is pretty poor, and the method is fairly inefficient. Should be a little faster than lawl’s approach though so i win

Read full topic
